hume
Class RND

java.lang.Object
  hume.RND

public class RND
extends java.lang.Object

This purpose of class RND is to define one particular random number generator that is to be used throughout the simulation. Additionally, it provides a few useful methods for picking a certain number of samples from a set of numbers or picking an entry from a probability distribution.

This allows to reproduce simulation results exactly by reusing the same seed for the random number generator.

By default the java.util.Random generator is used. In order to make the simulation reproducible, the seed should either be set before the simulation run via method setSeed or it should be read via methodgetSeed and be included in the simulation report, so that it can be set to exactly the same value when trying to reproduce the simulation results 1:1. STATUS: mature.

Author:
eckhart

random

public static java.util.Random random
The random number generator to be used by any class within the simulation. Defaults to the standard java random number generator.

Method Detail

getSeed

public static long getSeed()
Returns the seed the random number generator was initialized with.

setSeed

public static void setSeed(long seed)
Sets the seed of the random number generator. This should be done only between simulation runs.

Parameters:
seed - long value that contains the seed of the random number generator.

pickNewSeed

public static void pickNewSeed()
Initialize the random number generator with a new seed. The seed can be read via the method getSeed. This method should always be called before staring a new simulation, so that the simulation begings with a "defined" state of the random number generator.

sample

public static int[] sample(int n,
                           int range)
Picks n random numbers from the range [0..range[, no number occuring twice

Parameters:
n - the number of samples to pick
range - the upper limit of the range (exclusive)
Returns:
the array of random numbers

normalized

public static double[] normalized(double[] vector)
Returns the normalized vector, the entries of which add up to 1

Parameters:
vector - vector that is to be normalized
Returns:
the normalized vector

select

public static int select(double[] distribution)
Selects a random value from a probability distribution

Parameters:
distribution - an array of positive real values
Returns:
the index of the value picked
